dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALTER VALE, sixty-two, is standing by the window of his modestly furnished Colonial house. He is holding a glass wine and peering out through the drapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few moments an OLD CAR pulls up. A slightly overweight WOMAN gets out of the car. She starts to walk to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter steps back from the window and waits. The doorbell rings. Walter takes a last sip of wine and sets the glass down on the end table. And then he goes to the door and o it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Vale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. I'm Barbra Watson. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps into the house and Walter shuts the door. They stand there awkwardly. Barbara is tightly wound and overcompensates with a forced pleasantness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I take your coat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Would you like anything to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (Beat) Shall we get started?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Barbara sit side by side in a very close proximity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Remember, fingers curved. Like a tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter starts to play the piano. It's a lesson in progres They are sitting at a beautiful GRAND PIANO but Walter is only a beginner. And not a very good beginner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't flatten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter keeps playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make room for the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said "make room for the train." It's something that I tell my kids. If you curve your fingers like this... (She demonstrates) Then the train can pass through the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passes her pencil through her curved fingers. Walter looks at her for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks Barbara to the front door. He opens it and t hands Barbara some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Next Tuesday at the same time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't think I'm going to continue with our lessons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Are you giving up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara gets the point. He is stopping with her, not the lessons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. OK. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara walks out the door and then turns before Walter s it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Vale? If I may ask, how many teachers have you had before me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for what it's worth, it's difficult to learn an instrument at your age. Especially if you don't possess a natural gift for it. I'm not saying this to be mean. But if you do decide to give up then I would really like to buy your piano. It's a beautiful instrument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods, not quite sure how to receive the comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara turns and leaves. Walter shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stands before a half-empty class. He is wrapping u lecture on economic theory. There is nothing inspiring ab it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: East Asia's experience is really the exception to the rule, because the conditions there that made trade liberalization for the Middle East successful weren't present in the developing countries in sub- Saharan Africa, and in Central and South America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks across the campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits in a meeting with seven other COLLEAGUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is staring out the window in his simple but very l in office. Classical music plays softly in the background knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STUDENT opens the door and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down and sets a paper on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry it's late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had some personal things to deal with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter hands back the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I can't accept it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter goes back to work. The Student sits stunned for a moment and then gets up and picks up his paper. He opens door and then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you still haven't given us a syllabus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Lying) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Student shakes his head and leaves without another wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pulls into the driveway of his house. He gets out, grabs his belongings out of the back seat and walks insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is making dinner. Classical music plays from the o room. He adjusts the flame and covers a sauce pot. He lea against the counter and picks up a half empty bottle of w and pours some into his glass. He catches sight of A SMAL FRAMED PICTURE of him and HIS WIFE, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits at the piano and practices. It is still going badly. The wine glass sits on top of the piano. He lifts hand and inspects his "tunnel".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is at his computer. He pulls up his YEAR SYLLABUS the computer and carefully changes 2005 to 2006. He saves His work is done. There is a knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Walter's colleague, CHARLES VAN HORN s in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to interrupt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, Shelley can't make it down to the NYU conference to present your paper. I'm going to need you to cover for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't she go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been put on bed rest until she has the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is caught off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next week. We'll cover your class and make the arrangements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could, but now is not a very good time, Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand but you co-authored the paper and the Dean wants it presented. He wants to keep Shelley on track for tenure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't think I can with the start of classes and my book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're only teaching one class, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I can stay focused on my writing. I'd really rather not go right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry but there really isn't another option at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is trapped. He comes clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles, the truth is this is really Shelley's paper. I just agreed to co-author it because she asked me to. I'm not really prepared to present it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That may be the case but you are the co-author and she can't go. Look Walter, you can take it up with the Dean if you want, but, as your friend, I wouldn't advise it. Not with that argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter just stares him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Charles is gone, shutting the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits at the end of a bar at a local pub. He is rea the newspaper. KAREN, a 44-year-old bartender, is talking a BlONDE HAIRED WOMAN at other end of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall is covered with HAND DRAWN CARICATURES OF REGULA PATRONS. A WAITER hands a plate of food to Karen. She wal down the bar and sets it in front of Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, cutey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I thought you forgot about me. Where've you been hiding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen automatically refills his wine glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just busy with work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you're never gonna make it on the wall with that excuse. I'm glad your back. Give a holler if you need anything. I'm just gabbing with one of my girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks back down the bar. Walter starts to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cars are parked in Walter's driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is packing, laying out his shirts on the bed. Afte moment, Karen walks in, drying her hair with a towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today after class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes her earrings of the night stand and puts them i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like fun. I'm gonna go have a cigarette. You want some coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen leaves. Walter keeps packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits at a table and eats lunch alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks across the parking lot and gets into his car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter drives along the highway. He notices a SIGN which reads "Support Our Troops!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's car drives down the F.D.R Highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter drives through the small busy streets of the East Village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pulls into a parking garage. He gets out and takes ticket from the attendant. He grabs his bag and briefcase from the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks down the street, taking in the sights and sounds the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks out of a liquor store with a SMALL BROWN BAG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter arrives at a classic tenement building. He looks u the building as if inspecting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out his keys. He opens the door and walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks into the well-lit but dingy foyer.   A YOUNG brushes by him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He arrives at the second floor and stops in front of a do He unlocks the door and walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter steps into the apartment and drops his bags. He immediately notices that the kitchen light is on. Somethi is not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns on the living room light and crosses to the kitc table and sets the brown bag down. It's then that he noti some fresh flowers on the kitchen table. He looks slightl confused. He looks around the apartment. There is an UPRI PIANO along one wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer. He walks down a LONG HALLWAY and look the kitchen. Nothing. He walks over to the FIRST BEDROOM looks inside. There are signs of someone living there. He looks in the SECOND BEDROOM. He sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he hears the sound of running water from the bathroom. He notices a light under the door. He walks to bathroom and listens. A faucet is turned and the water st running. He opens the door and looks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG BLACK WOMAN is soaking in the bath tub.   She see Walter and screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter screams too and then slams the door, stepping back into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has a West African accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK. I'm not going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone! My boyfriend is coming home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? What are you doing in here!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? This apartment does not belong to you. How did you get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Walter Vale. I have keys. It's my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Walter is pushed up against the wall. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very angry, YOUNG MIDDLE EASTERN MAN is in Walter's fac He grabs Walter violently by the collar and shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?! Zainab?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in here! He is crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! I am not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Middle Eastern Man slams him against the wall. more of a warning shot then a violent act. Walter is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) Tarek. What is happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) I have no idea! I was in the bath and he was just standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shaking Walter) Did you touch her?! Did you touch her?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) He didn't touch me! But how did he get in? He said he has keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! I have keys. It's my apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek stares at Walter, trying to make sense of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in French) What does he mean it's his apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! Show me your keys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter reaches into his pocket and holds up his keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my apartment. I've owned it for twenty-five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why haven't you been here!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live in Connecticut. I haven't used it in a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is starting to get through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you friends with Ivan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivan? Who is Ivan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek is getting nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) I knew this would happen! He probably called the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This catches Tarek's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Walter) Did you call the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't call the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek looks like he might belt Walter. Instead, he lets h go and quickly backs up. He paces while trying to gather thoughts. Walter doesn't move. Zainab runs into the bedro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you don't know Ivan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know Ivan. Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rented us this place. He said it belonged to his friend who was out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who he is but this is my apartment. I assure you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek looks at Walter for a long moment. It's clear that telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) I told you not to trust anyone. You never saw a contract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! OK. Look. We don't want any trouble. We will get out of your apartment. This is all a mistake. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will leave, OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab emerges from the bedroom. She is dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) Where are we going to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) I don't know but we have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) I know we have to go. I am not stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm just going to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods and then slowly walks down the hallway and si down. He is clearly shaken. Tarek shuts the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if I hurt you. Are you sure that you're OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Well, we'll pack up and get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek walks back toward the bedroom. Walter tries to catc his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is sitting on the couch with a glass of wine. Tare enters and sets down a bag. He picks up TWO AFRICAN DRUMS next to the piano and places them by the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab enters from the bedroom mumbling something in an African dialect. She drops a bag and crosses back to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I'm in trouble when she starts speaking Wolof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you lived here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two months. We will pay you if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter doesn't respond. Zainab emerges from the bedroom a with the last bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Zainab) Is that everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. Do you want to check!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a SMALL PLASTIC BAG from a local grocery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here is the coffee you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snatches it without a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Walter) OK. So we'll go. I am sorry again. Thank you for your understanding. Good bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and exit. Walter gets up and walks over to the front door and locks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands by the front door trying to process the events. Then something catches his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks to the window and picks up a handcrafted, decorative FRAME off of the sill. It is a PHOTOGRAPH of T and Zainab. They are hugging each other and smiling. Walt looks down onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Zainab and Tarek exit the building and cross the street. Zainab's cart tips on the curb and the contents s out onto the sidewalk. Tarek quickly moves to help her. Zainab yells at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter watches as they finally collect their belongings a move down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek has set his bags down in front of a closed store. H talking in a very agitated tone on his cell phone. Zainab stands by silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Look I know. Come on man, it'll just be for a night or two until we figure something out. OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Can you check and call me back? OK. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab points. Walter is standing there holding the frame photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left this at the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek walks over and takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where you're going to stay tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lie is obvious. They are stuck. Walter just nods agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter takes some books out of his briefcase. He crosses the bookshelf and sets them down. He notices a small stac CD's sitting on a shelf. He picks one of them up and star at the CD for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like classical music, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sets down the CD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Do you play piano?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (Beat) Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? No. I play the djembe. Well, thanks again for letting us stay. You saved me a lot of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek goes to bed. Walter resumes his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is lying in bed, unable to sleep. He can hear Tare and Zainab whispering and laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek and Zainab are lying in bed together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Tarek. He'll hear us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. He's asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let him hear. The guy probably needs some excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's probably had enough for one night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek nuzzles her. Zainab laughs but pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek. No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab sits up in the bed. Tarek relents and rolls onto h back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do, Tarek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We'll figure it out tomorrow. Who knows? Maybe he'll let us stay. He's not really using the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be his roommate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. OK. So we'll figure it out in the morning. I promise, habibti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab rolls over and straddles Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even a little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets very close to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your punishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about our roommate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him long and hard. They start to make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob walks outside with Sprinkles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is tying his tie in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks out of his bedroom and runs into Zainab who leaving her bedroom at the same time. It's obvious that s was trying to avoid Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kimmel Center towers over Washington Square Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is listening to the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That will be on the last day of conference. I hope you can all attend. And now I'd like to welcome my distinguished colleague and the winner of John Bates Clark Award, Stephen Kriegman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN KRIEGMAN strides to the podium. He is a good deal younger then Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Shiva. Good morning. It's a pleasure to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter mingles at a reception. He is listening to another COLLEAGUE tell a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so I just stood up and walked out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group laughs. Stephen Kriegman approaches and talks t the COLLEAGUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter eats dinner in a large, well appointed banquet roo Walter listens as a CHATTY MAN talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is walking up the stairs carrying a briefcase. He passes a MIDDLE-AGED MAN who is walking down the stairs w a SMALL DOG on a leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stops and turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Mr. Vale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so. How are you? It's me, Jacob Konigsberg. Do you remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to live here with my mother. Your wife used to give me piano lessons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has been a long time. I thought that maybe you sold the place. Oh. This is Sprinkles. (To the dog) Say "hi", Sprinkles. Is your wife here with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She passed away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! No! I had no idea. I'm so sorry. She was such a nice lady. And I just loved listening to her play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moved to Florida. Now I live here. It's nice. There are a lot of new faces. I hardly know anyone anymore. But I have Sprinkles so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you, Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Mr. Vale. Goodbye. Welcome back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods and keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks into the apartment. No one else is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets down his case and walks toward his bedroom but st at Tarek and Zainab's door, which is closed. He listens. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is reading over and "rehearsing" the paper that he to present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sotto) It is important to distinguish between both our current political assessment and our...It is important to distinguish between our current political assessment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops and crosses out the world "both". He continues reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is practicing the piano. He continues to struggle. sits back and takes a break. He notices the drum next to piano. He looks at it for long moment and then continues playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is lying in bed awake. He listens as Tarek and Zai come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter buys a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is back at the conference. He is listening to a presentation by a GERMAN ECONOMIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However, we do find that financial globalization can be beneficial under the right circumstances. Empirically, good institutions and quality of governance are crucial in helping developing countries derive the benefits of globalization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter checks his watch. He is obviously bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is sitting in the park and eating some Indian food from a local cart vendor. He finishes and drops it into t garbage can. He checks his watch and starts to head back toward the conference when a SOUND catches his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter watches two young AFRICAN AMERICAN MEN drumming on BUCKETS with reckless abandon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have them come play inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter turns. THREE COLLEAGUES from the conference are standing next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. In a minute. (Holding up his cell phone) I have to make a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods as the guys walk off. Walter watches them go. turns and watches the drumming again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter arrives on the top floor. He can hear the drum bei played. He stops in front of his apartment. He listens fo moment and then slowly opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek is playing his drum in his T-shirt and underwear. H sees Walter and finishes with a flourish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Walter. Welcome home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek casually gets up and puts on his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're home early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a half day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was the conference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek buttons his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about the pants. I've been playing like this since I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I think I might have a lead on a place in Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. You can keep practicing if you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? It won't bother you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Thanks. I'll keep my pants on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek laughs. Walter smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Zainab's going to make dinner if you want to eat with us later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks into his bedroom. Tarek watches him go and t starts playing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is lying down on his bed reading through his paper His foot is tapping to the rhythm of the drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Zainab are sitting at the dinner table finishi their meal. Tarek is on the phone in the living room spea in Arabic. He hangs up and rejoins the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. That was my mother. If I don't call her every day she thinks something happened to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pours himself some wine. He offers some to Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'll have a bit. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab shoots Tarek a glance. Walter misreads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure that you wouldn't like some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Jokingly) She is a good Muslim. I'm a bad one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods. Zainab gets up and starts to clear the table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you finished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank you. Here, let me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the least I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her comment is more of an indictment than a pleasantry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you for the dinner. It was very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the conference about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Economic Growth in Developing Nations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's us. (Pointing) Syria. Senegal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So have you written some books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three. I'm working on my fourth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four books?! Great. My father was a writer. A journalist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he still writing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He died. Before we left Syria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek. It's eight-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. We have to go. (To Walter) I have a gig tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab starts to put on her coat.   Tarek picks up his dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, you can come if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab shoots Tarek a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get some work done but thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Well maybe another time

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek and Zainab leave. Walter watches them go and then l around the empty apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek and Zainab are walking down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) Why did you invite him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) We're staying in his apartment. What could I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) Well I would have been the one stuck sitting with him while you played your drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek turns and looks at her very seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you are very sexy when you're mad at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab can't help but smile. Tarek starts to wrap his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek and Zainab stop in their tracks, already three flig down. They both look up the stairwell. Walter is looking on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't mind, I think I will come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek and Zainab share a quick look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter disappears back into the apartment. Zainab looks a Tarek. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek's Jazz Trio is playing. Walter and Zainab sit at a small table in the back. Walter is rapt. Zainab is sketch She looks up from her pad and watches him before returnin her drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Zainab are standing outside on the empty stree There's an awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole band is very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then nothing. Finally Tarek emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry guys. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is sitting in the park and eating PIZZA. This time is sitting directly across from the two African American drummers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks into the apartment and sets down his briefca He notices Tarek's drum sitting in the middle of the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one answers. Walter walks down the hallway a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks back into the living room and takes off his coat. He removes some papers from his briefcase and then notices the drum again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down in the chair next to Tarek's drum. He takes drum between his legs and he hits it a few times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he starts to play. He stops and then he plays again. This time he is slightly more successful at finding a rhy He closes his eyes and bobs his head. He's really getting into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens his eye's open and Tarek is standing in front of him. He has headphones around his neck. Walter jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounded good Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter immediately stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well. I was just...I'm sorry if I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek walks over and grabs another chair from the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be sorry. That's what it's there for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek sets the chair down and grabs the other drum from beside the piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was lying on my bed listening to my music and then I was like "what's the crazy rhythm I'm hearing?".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek sits down with the other drum facing Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit. Come on. I'll show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter hesitates and then sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just put your feet flat on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter adjusts his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now take the drum between your legs. Like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek grabs the drums with his knees. Walter follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you want to lift the inside edge off the ground with your ankles. Like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter watches Tarek and follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Feel OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Now Walter, I know you're a very smart man but with the drum you have to remember not to think. Thinking just screws it up. OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now just give it a couple of bangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter gives it a couple of hard bangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so hard. You're not angry at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Right.     Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bangs it a few more times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better. Did you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now one more thing, Walter. You listen to classical music so you think in fours. One. Two. Three. Four. Da. Da. Da. Da. This is an African drum. So we are gonna play in three's. Tat. Tat. Tat. You have to forget your classical. Leave it behind. Tat. Tat. Tat. One. Two. Three. Come on. Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek bangs out a simple bass beat. Walter joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Good ear. Now keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter loses the beat.   Tarek keeps playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Start again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter tries again. And again. And then finally he gets i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! There it is. OK. Good. Now keep it going and I will do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek riffs off of Walter's bass beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's it. Keep it going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab is closing up her booth. Another VENDOR walks by a says good bye. Zainab smiles and nods good bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab is walking home with her supplies. Two NEW YORK PO OFFICERS are talking to THREE YOUNG HISPANIC KIDS. Zainab hesitates for the slightest moment before lowering her he and walking past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab enters the apartment and sees Walter drumming. His shirt is unbuttoned exposing his white undershirt. He sto He is breathing very hard and sweating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Where is Tarek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She places her items down on the kitchen table and takes her coat. She looks around the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went out. To look at another apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just looks at him with the drum. Walter is still out breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Tarek is teaching me the drum. I'm practicing. Don't worry, I'll keep my pants on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab looks shocked. Walter's attempt at levity has fall short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I was just...nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab nods and walks into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek is playing with his band. Walter is at the bar watching. He is unconsciously tapping along on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek, Walter, and Darren - the saxophone player - sit at table by the window, eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Walter, what time are you done tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to present a paper at eleven. I should be done by twelve- thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the waiter) Hey man, could we get another order of this? (To Walter and Tarek) I love this food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. Because the Chinese are taking over the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already happening. One day our kids will be going to China for jobs. Ask Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren and Tarek look at Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is put on the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...if China continues to threaten the wage earners in the first-world economies by keeping wages down, then it's really just a matter of time. What they buy they inflate. What they sell they deflate. But then you have to ask the question `who's paying the cost?'. And the answer is the Chinese people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek continues eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is presenting his paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is walks out of the building talking to a FEMALE COLLEAGUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Walter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and the Female Colleague turn. Tarek is standing a feet away holding both drums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods and says good bye to the Colleague who looks bit confused. Walter walks over to Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did the presentation go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Guess what? I found an apartment in Brooklyn. We can move in on Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's small but it's a nice building. I just hope Zainab likes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she will as long as no else lives there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're right. Come on, let's go. You should take off the name tag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter takes off his name tag and they start to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm starving. Do you like shwarmas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...yeah. I like sharmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shwarmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk across the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Tarek are finishing lunch. Tarek reaches into bag and takes out a SMALL BAG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. This is for you. For letting us stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter takes it and opens it. It's a CD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Fela Kuti. You know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know Fela? Oh, man! Walter, you are in for a treat. He started the whole Afro-Beat movement. And his drummer Tony Allen was just scary, man. You want to play drums, you have to listen to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HANDSOME ARAB MAN walks past with a PRETTY BLONDE WOMAN Tarek sees him and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Hey Tarek. How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Good, Omar. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Not bad. It's fall in New York, you know? How's the band?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Good. Playing a lot. New girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) New friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) You have a lot friends

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) I'm a very nice guy. Au revoir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Au revoir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omar walks off. Tarek shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lebanese. Bunch of playboys. You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pick up their drums and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab is talking to two UPPER EAST SIDE WOMEN who have stopped at her stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-five dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take thirty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. thiry-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. I know my daughter will think it's "cool". Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands her the money. Zainab takes it and drops it int small pouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senegal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I was in Cape Town two winters ago. It was just beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Handing her the bag) Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman walks away. A young Israeli man, ZEV is sitting a nearby stall selling T-shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far is Senegal from Cape Town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told a guy I was from Israel yesterday and he asked if I had ever visited the Holy Land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab smiles. Zev sees someone over Zainab's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look who it is. What's up Tarek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek and Walter are approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zev!   How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses Zainab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Hi, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh. You know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks at the Zainab's jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her stuff is great, right? She made me this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek holds up his wrist, revealing a bracelet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should make one for Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab nods noncommittally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Walter and I are going up to the park to play for a little bit. OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek, I told you we have to pick up my new table today. He said he would only hold it for today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know. No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek. You always say "no problem" and then you are late or you forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I will not be long. We'll go up and play and then we'll come back to help you. I promise, habibti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her and starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's always "habibti" when you want your way. It closes at five p.m. Not Arab time, Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not Arab time. Real time, habibti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't "habibti" me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and start to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does habibti mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Habibti? It means "beloved one".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek and Walter are waiting for the subway. A CHINESE MUSICIAN is playing on the opposite platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been playing here for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea but it's cool. I always wanted to play down here. It's supposed to be good money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe some day we can do it together. Split the profits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter watches the Chinese Musician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Tarek stand in front of the DRUM CIRCLE    in Central Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sizes it up and makes his assessment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll just watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's easy. You just wait until you feel it. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek joins the drum circle. Walter lingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is on the edge of the Drum Circle, waiting to "fee it". Tarek is next to him playing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek looks at Walter and nods. Finally Walter starts to play. Slowly at first, but then he starts to really commi Tarek encourages him with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek and Walter are leaving the park. Tarek checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, we have to get home. Zainab is gonna kill me. I'm on Arab time again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is Arab time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means I'm late by an hour. All Arabs are late by an hour. It's genetic. We can't help it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek and Walter hurry down the stairs of the subway stat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Tarek approach the turnstile.     They can hea train arriving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our train!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pick up the pace. Walter puts down his drum to take his METROCARD. Tarek quickly picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your drum. My card is empty. Can you swipe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter swipes his card for Tarek to pass through and then swipes his own turnstile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter passes through. Tarek struggles a bit with both drums. He gets halfway through when the turnstile bar loc He's stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Laughing) Hey. You paid for the drum and not me. Here take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter takes Tarek's drum and Tarek quickly ducks under t turn style that Walter just paid for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Re: the train) I think we missed it. Zainab is not going to be happy if...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a MAN takes Tarek by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir. Could you please step over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek reacts by pulling his arm away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NYPD. Could you please step over here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for Tarek again who instinctively moves his ar again which agitates the Cop. Another COP enters into the action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just step over here, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, what do you want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You jumped the turnstile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not jump it! I paid. I paid! It just didn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter steps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I did pay his fare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you step back please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I paid this man's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, stand over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Tarek) Can I see some ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek takes out his wallet. He shows them an ID CARD. Wal steps back to the wall and sets the two drums down. Cop # stands between him and the action. Walter can barely make what is being said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got anything else, Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Syria. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek is starting to panic. The two Cops share a look. Another train passes. Cop #1 asks Tarek a few more questi which Walter cannot hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Cop #1 starts to handcuff Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? I'm sorry. What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter steps forward to intervene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we do. You can come down to the station and make a statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he didn't mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, that's all I'm saying. Now step back or we are gonna take you in too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you taking him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninth Precinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter take the drum. Tell Zainab what happened but don't let her come for me. I will call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Cops lead Tarek away. Walter watches helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let her come! I will call her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter enters and shuts the door and Zainab is sitting on couch working on her jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops when she sees Walter standing alone, holding th two drums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Tarek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. In the subway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab immediately starts to panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrested?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It was just a misunderstanding. They said he would be released later tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab really starts to lose it. Her reaction is more tha Walter was prepared for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could this happen? He knows better! He would not do anything wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't. I'm sure we it will be OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to pack up her work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It won't be OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it will. I went down to the precinct and made a statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Snapping at Walter) That doesn't matter! He is illegal! As am I! We are not citizens. Do you know what that means? Do you?! Of course you don't. How could you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up her things and walks down the hall to her ro Walter sits, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is talking on his cell phone and pacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. His name is Tarek Khalil. Khalil. K. H. A. L. I. L. That's right. Yes. I came down and made a statement. They said he would be released. That was six hours ago. Well when should we know? Tomorrow? Why? But he...OK. OK. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks out of the police station. He crosses the street. Zainab is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've moved him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To a detention center in Queens. He was turned over to immigration. They said we can see him during visiting hours tomorrow night from five to ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't visit him or I will end up in that place too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab fights to restrain her emotions. She turns and wal away. Walter watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab's bedroom light is on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. WALTER'S APARTMENT, TAREK'S & ZAINAB'S ROOM - SA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab is sitting on her bed and talking on her phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. We are going tomorrow. The appointment is at eleven. I don't know, he found him. What? No. I don't want to. I just don't, Tarek. Yes. I've already called him. I know. I know. I just want you to be here with me, Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sea of skyscrapers near One Center Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab and Walter exit an elevator and walk down the hall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Zainab talk to an, MR. SHAH, an INDIAN IMMIGRA LAWYER who is jotting down notes. He is clinical, almost in his approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab, you're also undocumented, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you can't visit Tarek at the detention center, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you known Tarek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Vale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Tarek have any family living here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks to Zainab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother lives in Michigan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is news to Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's also undocumented, correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK. This is all confidential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she know that Tarek is in custody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Tarek told me not to tell her. He doesn't want to worry her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has he ever been convicted of a crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He has had no trouble. He is a good person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know if they ever applied for asylum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks at Zainab. She is very uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. When he first arrived from Syria. But he didn't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And did they appeal it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Shah jots something down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't they appeal it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear of being deported. It used to be that when your asylum case was denied, they let you go until your appeal. A lot of people didn't bother with it. Getting denied once was enough to spook them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happens if that's the case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there may be a final order of deportation on him which means he won't even go before a judge this time. He'll just be deported.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had to leave Syria! They had no choice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is also news to Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, one step at a time. Let me talk to him then we'll have a better idea of his status and what our options are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything I can do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visit him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lawyer slides a card across the table. Walter takes i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter rides the subway. He looks down at the lawyer's ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter emerges from the subway into a very industrial neighborhood. Factories and fences. He checks his piece o paper and starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is still walking. The area is very deserted. He st and tries to locate a street address amongst the anonymou factories. He checks his sheet of paper and continues walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is standing in front of the DETENTION CENTER. It l like most of the other factories around it but perhaps wi bit more barbed wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses a button and the automated door slowly opens. walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks into a small brightly lit waiting room. A fe SODA MACHINES and TWELVE BLUE PLASTIC CHAIRS. In one corn is a guard booth with THREE GUARDS. One FEMALE GUARD is wearing a Muslim headdress. Walter approaches the window waits in line. The other people waiting comprise a mix of nationalities: African, Latin American, Chinese, Indian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard talks to a MAN in front of Walter. The Man has Slavic accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That detainee has been moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was here yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now he's not. That's all I know. You can call ICE. The number is on the wall. Next. Sir, step aside please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Slavic Man reluctantly steps aside, staring at a piec paper. Walter steps up to the window. He sets a piece of paper on the window sill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm here to see Tarek Khalil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been here before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see your license please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter takes out his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is let through a large metal door. There is an X-R MACHINE immediately in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter empties his pockets and steps through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter waits for the sliding metal door to open. It does he steps into a small room. The door slides shut and he i alone in the small white room until a door on the other s slides open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps through and walks down a small hallway. On the l side of the hallway are small, glassed in, meeting rooms lawyer consultations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter enters into a large bright room. It resembles a pr visitation room. Along the perimeter of the room is a cle fiberglass wall with twenty-five small cubicles. Each cub has one seat and a phone. On the other side of the fiberg is another seat and a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks around the room at the VISITORS and DETAINEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is still waiting. After a moment a door opens and Tarek walks out wearing a blue jump suit. He sees Walter smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They each move toward the other and settle into a vacant seat. They both pick up the phone as they sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter. Thank you for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is Zainab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's upset. I have a letter from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't give it to me. It has to be sent to me by mail. But you can put it up to the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Open it and place it up to the glass so I can read it. It's OK. It's allowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter complies. He sets down the phone so that he can pr the letter up against the glass. Tarek reads the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks around the room, trying to give Tarek some privacy. He watches the various immigrant families speaki to one another. Tarek taps the glass and points to Walter phone. Walter picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods as he folds up the envelope and places it bac into his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are they treating you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. The place is very depressing. There is no privacy. The lights are always on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just want to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab and I met with a lawyer today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is going to stop by to see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both sit for a moment. Unsure what to say next. Fina Walter's curiosity gets the best of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek, Zainab said you were denied asylum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean when we came here? Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you go to your deportation hearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We did everything they told us to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter can only nod, unsure of what else to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, could you tell Darren? I didn't call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD walks past and taps Tarek on the shoulder and spe to him. We can't hear what is being said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Walter) I have to go. They have to do a bed count. Usually, I can visit for one hour. Can you come tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. And tell Zainab I will call her as soon as I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods. Tarek gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek walks away. Walter watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Zainab are sitting at the kitchen table. Zaina holding her letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ask him if he went to his hearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He said that he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, I'm going to leave now. I have a cousin in the Bronx. I will stay with him for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to leave. You can stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's best if I leave. When Tarek calls me then I will tell him. You know how to reach me if you need to. Is it OK if I leave Tarek's things here for now? My cousin's place is not very big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab walks away from the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter drinks at the bar and watches Tarek's band play without Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter practices the drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob walks Sprinkles in front of the apartment building. Walter walks outside and waves hello as he walks past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren and Tarek are talking. Walter sits and listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter eats alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter buys the morning paper from a kiosk. He walks to t corner and waits to cross the street. A large group of CHINESE TOURISTS led by a TOUR GUIDE step up next to him. is surrounded by them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek talks to Mr. Shah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is playing the drum. He finishes with an "end beat He looks around the quiet apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is waiting for Tarek. The visiting room is empty. Suddenly the door opens on the detainee side of the glass a VERY YOUNG LATIN WOMAN walks out tentatively. She almos looks absurd in the oversized blue jumpsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Walter, unsure if she is supposed to approac the glass and talk to him. Walter just stares back, also unsure of what to do. They are caught in awkward moment. Finally Walter manages a nod. She nods back and smiles. I the innocent smile of a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a female guard appears in the doorway and beckon the Young Girl back inside. The Young Girl looks at Walte one last moment before disappearing behind the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is talking to Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought you said you went to the hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did. I remember it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why is there a final order on you? Did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He didn't know yet. He just said that unless he can find a way to reopen the case quickly they're going to deport me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should call your mother. She might have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't want her to worry. I can handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Three years ago I was working for some guy who said he was going to sponsor me for my green card but then he turned out to be jerk. But the lawyer said that might allow us to reopen the case. I don't even understand it.
