dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, there are guys who have been in here for years! I can't do that Walter. I'll go crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to deal with the case as quickly as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek goes silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek. I have to go back to Connecticut. I'll be reachable by phone if you need me for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek's mind is racing. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Just please...don't forget about me in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still practicing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should go back to the drum circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quickly) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. But listen to that Fela CD. That will help you, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So show me what you've been working on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me. On that. Come on. I need some music, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek points to the shelf in front of Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. They can't arrest you. At least not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks around and then cradles the phone in his shoulder and starts to bang a simple beat on his counter Tarek watches and listens for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. There it is. Good. Good. You are getting better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he joins in. The two men continue to play togeth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is packing his suitcase. Suddenly there is a knock his door. He exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter opens the door. Standing there is a strikingly attractive forty-five year-old ARAB WOMAN. She seems star to see Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I must have the wrong apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to walk down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Tarek's mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. This is Tarek's apartment. I...share the apartment with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Arab Woman is cautious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did not mention that he lived with someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not here very often. I live in Connecticut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Tarek here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's...uh...he's not here. But please come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna walks into the apartment. She stands by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Walter. Walter Vale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mouna Khalil. I'm sorry to show up unannounced but my son calls me everyday. He has not called me now for five days. I have tried his cell phone but he does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to sit down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like something to drink? Coffee or water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Is my son alright, Mr. Vale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek was arrested. He's being held in a detention center in Queens. They are trying to deport him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Queens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not far from here. Twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have been there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I saw him yesterday. He's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was stopped in the subway station. He didn't do anything wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to go there. To Queens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. But Mrs. Khalil. The lawyer mentioned that...I don't think that you can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I can't visit Tarek, Mr. Vale. I just want to see where they are holding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. I can take you if you'd like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get my coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna nods. Walter leaves. Mouna breathes deeply in an attempt to control her emotions. She looks around the apartment and spots Tarek's drum. The sight of it is almo enough to push her over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chinese Musician is playing on the platform. Mouna an Walter are watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna are sitting side by side on the subway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna exit the subway station and walk down th empty street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been to New York before, Mrs. Khalil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Tarek wanted to come to New York to play music. I did not want him to go but...do you have children, Mr. Vale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a son. He lives in London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife passed away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna stop across the street from the detentio Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where the prison is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter points to the Detention Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does not look like a prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many people are in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek said about three hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a coffee shop on that corner. It's not very nice but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait there. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a letter out of her bag and hands it to Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter turns and walks into the facility. Mouna lingers, taking in the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is waiting for Tarek. He is watching as a LATIN WO holds her BABY up to the glass as her HUSBAND taps on it the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally a door opens and Tarek walks out. He waves and smiles. Walter picks up his phone. Tarek picks up his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, I thought you were leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was.   Tarek, your mother is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stops Tarek cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? My mother?! Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is waiting outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did she arrive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man. Why did she come? She can do nothing for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said she hadn't heard from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter. Listen to me. She can not stay here. She doesn't know anyone in New York. I'm sorry but you must get her to go back to Michigan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. OK. Here. I have a letter from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter takes it out and puts it up to the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dingy place occupied by truck drivers and factory workers. Mouna sitting in a booth clutching a cup of tea. looks very out of place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two DETENTION CENTER GUARDS enter and sit down in a booth Mouna watches them. An Arab Waiter is cleaning the counte He keeps looking at Mouna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) I am Palestinian from Damascus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Ah. I knew it. I am from Egypt. Alexandria. I'm Nasim. Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) I am visiting my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) He is in detention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waiter shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) It's a bad place. I'm lucky. I have a green card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods to the Guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) They're the ones taking care of your son. They come here everyday. They don't tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna is uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arab) Don't worry. They can't understand us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter enters and walks over to Mouna's booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods and sits down. He hands Mouna her letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's good but he's concerned about you being here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Khalil, I'm not sure that your being in New York will do any good. We have a very good lawyer working on Tarek's case...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Politely but forceful) Mr. Vale, I cannot go back to Michigan knowing that my son is in that building. Even if I can't see him, I will stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up, ready to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stands. Mouna digs in her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) The tea is on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Is that your lawyer? Or your husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) See you next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter follows Mouna out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna arrive back at Walter's apartment buildi Jacob emerges from the front door with Sprinkles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Hello, Mr. Vale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Mouna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello again. Did you find your son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Walter) I let her in earlier. (To Mouna) I'm Jacob, by the way. I live on the third floor. And this is Sprinkles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Jacob. I'm Mouna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you two know each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Mr. Vale knows my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Who is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Tarek. He is very nice. And so is his girlfriend. They are both so polite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother and I are planning a trip to go to Israel next summer. She's always wanted to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you enjoy it. Now if you'll excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna nods and heads into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure. We need to go on our walk and do our business. Very nice to meet you, Mouna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna continues up the stairs. Walter follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Mr. Vale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna enter the apartment. Mouna picks up her suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Vale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will find a hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stay here. You can use Tarek's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your offer but I cannot accept this. I don't want to impose on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not imposing. Please. I would like you to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, thank you. But I will manage. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter finally steps aside and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna walks down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Khalil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns. Walter is standing at the top of the stairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I was with Tarek when he was arrested. He was in the subway in the first place because of me. Please. Stay. Even if it's just for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's plea is heartfelt. Mouna looks at him and then s looks down the stairs for a long moment, considering her options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter enters the room and sets down Mouna's suitcase. Sh follows him into the cramped bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom is just across the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Vale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can call me Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I am Mouna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Thank you. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter leaves, shutting the door behind him. Mouna sits o the bed and looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desolate streets. The sound of an airplane taking off bre the night quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks out of his bedroom. He hears talking from th living room. He walks down the hall and sees Mouna sittin the couch in the living room, talking on her cell phone i Arabic. He turns and walks back down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pours a cup of coffee. He notices two newspaper's the counter. One is the Financial Times and the other is Hayat, an Arabic newspaper. He picks up the Financial Tim and reads the front page. Mouna enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek said hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't really tell. He wants me to leave. But I am not leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you can stay here as long as you need to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. That is very generous of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for the newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna nods and pours some more coffee for herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter? Did Tarek and his girlfriend, Zainab, live here together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhm...Yes. They did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where is she now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's staying with her cousin in the Bronx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to meet her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can go by her stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her stall. She sells jewelry in a stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large office building in downtown Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna are standing in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you spend a lot of time in the city?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not really. I just came down to present a paper at a conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wrote it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Well I coauthored it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna are talking to the Mr. Shah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happened after the hearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We appealed. It took two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your appeal was denied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they should have sent you a bag-and-baggage letter which basically tells you where to show up and be deported.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you didn't receive it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I would remember this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Eventually we had to. But we had our mail advanced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Shah is satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it wouldn't be the first time that happened. And pre 9/11 it wasn't much of a priority tracking people down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna bristles at the implied connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if they didn't get the letter then does this help us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It keeps our chances alive. If they got it and just ignored it then we couldn't push to reopen the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you can help him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still a long shot. Like I said, the Government's approach has changed radically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very black and white now. Either you belong or you don't. Which means a lot of people who have been living here for years are suddenly being swept up and thrown into detention. (He starts writing) Tarek's lucky. Most of them don't even have lawyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna blanches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Without looking up) Relatively speaking. We just have to move quickly to get an emergency stay from the board of immigration. Then, we'll stick with the motion to reopen pending his green card application.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna and Walter share a look. They're lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you explain what that means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I don't have the time right now. I have to be in court very shortly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will he be in detention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Without looking up) I can't predict that. I'm sorry but I am gonna have to wrap this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks at Mouna. Mouna stares at the Mr. Shah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have children, Mr. Shah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Two kids. And for what it's worth my uncle was deported after raising a family here for twenty- three years. If I can get Tarek out, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna are standing at the fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. In the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) The black woman? That is Zainab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is very black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab is sitting at her table when Walter approaches. Za smiles. She is genuinely surprised and happy to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Zainab. This is Mouna Khalil. Tarek's mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab blanches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quickly stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Zainab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a pleasure to meet you, Mrs. Khalil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Call me Mouna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. I'm sorry. I did not know you were coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither did I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna looks at her for a long moment. Then she inspects h jewelry. Zainab is uncharacteristically nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your jewelry is very beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have time for coffee or a walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab looks around at her table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I would like that. But I have to watch my table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna and Zainab both turn to look at Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is sitting behind Zainab's table in the fair. It's long way from the classroom. A FEW YOUNG WOMEN walk past browse Zainab's jewelry. They look at Walter who just nod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna and Zainab sit and talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm living with my cousin. He has two kids. And his mother. I mean his wife...I'm sorry, I am very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Have you spoken with Tarek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He called me this morning. He is doing all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish that I could see him. Just for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. How long have you been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years. I was in detention when I first arrived. Three months. It was horrible. I would probably still be there but they closed the facility for poor conditions. They released some of the women on parole because we were...low risk. I met Tarek one year later. (Beat) I am sorry for what happened with Tarek. I hope you do not blame me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blame you?     No. I do not blame you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab starts to break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek was doing nothing wrong. I miss him so much. I don't know what I am going to do without him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said the same thing about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab, I would like you to do something for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like you to show me something that you and Tarek liked to do. Some place that you like to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything. Whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. But maybe we should get Walter first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both smile at the thought of Walter still at Zainab' table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna walk down the street listening to Zainab is wheeling her jewelry supplies behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, Mouna and Zainab are standing at the railing of t Ferry which is making its way across the harbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STATUE OF LIBERTY looms large; the ferry route provid a perfect vantage point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what is in Staten Island?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We never got off. We just would go to the other side and then come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's free. And it felt like we were going somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is where the towers were. I never saw them but Tarek did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab crosses to the other railing and points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And over there is the Statue.    And behind that is Ellis Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes Tarek would point at the statue and jump up and down like we were arriving to New York for the first time. It was very funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you go up in the Statue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's cell phone rings. He looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. (Into the phone) Hello? Oh. Hi Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks away from the Mouna and Zainab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? Yes. I'm still in New York actually. I stayed down here to do some research. What's that? Oh. I'm on a boat. Yes, a boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Charles, I'll explain when I see you but I have to go right now. I'll call you back. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter hangs up the phone and rejoins Mouna and Zainab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is visiting with Tarek. Another detainee walks beh Tarek and taps him on the shoulder. Tarek nods hello and keeps talking to Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went on the ferry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She liked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Zainab tell you how we used pretend we arriving in New York for the first time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She told us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know they don't even let us outside here. They just cut a hole in the roof in one place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's crazy stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they seemed to get along? Zainab and my mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I think your mother likes her very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek smiles. Then it fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother's not going home, is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know she's thinking about my father. He spent seven years in jail in Syria for something he wrote in the newspaper. By the time they released him he was very sick. He died two months later. That's when we came here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks the same thing is gonna happen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek thinks for a long moment. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I have never seen them together. Zainab and my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna are walking home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry, Mouna? We can stop for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would prefer to cook if you don't mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we stop at a market?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's probably a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna is preparing dinner. Walter comes in and takes a bo of wine out of the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a glass of wine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pours his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna? I need to go back to Connecticut tomorrow. For work. I told Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will you be gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know yet. I'll try to make it back to visit Tarek as soon as I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have keep visiting him, Walter. I'm sure you are busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Dinner will be ready soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna and Walter are eating in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you go to Broadway, Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broadway? Uhm. No. I haven't been in a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek sent me the CD for "Phantom of the Opera" for my birthday. The music is lovely. Have you seen it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I haven't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't either but I think I know every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter smiles. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek is teaching me the drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? How is it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I sound a lot better when he's playing with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is your teaching going, Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter seems caught off guard by the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My teaching?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I have a lighter schedule so I can work on my book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your book? What is it about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it covers quite a bit, so it's hard to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter drinks his glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you almost finished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like to talk about your work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's just a bit complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just is. It's just not a process that's easy to talk about with someone who's not a writer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's cheap shot lands. Mouna is stung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to pry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have spoken to you like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter picks up the wine bottle and fills his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is sitting on the edge of his bed and takes off hi shoes. He pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty New York street. Mouna and Walter round the corn walking together. She is holding his briefcase. Walter is carrying the drum and his duffle bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the Parking Garage. Walter hands a ticket the GARAGE ATTENDANT. He takes his briefcase from Mouna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. You have my number if you need anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine. Thank you. Have a safe trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well good bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna turns and walks down the street. Walter's car arriv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pulls into his driveway. He gets out of the car. H opens the trunk and takes out his bag and then his drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks into the lecture hall. He sets his briefcase down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out some papers and opens them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is stopped at a traffic light in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sees Karen walking toward him. She is talking on h cell phone and does not notice him. Walter just watches h pass without saying a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits in his office working. He stops and listens t the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pours himself a drink and wanders around the empty house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter opens the front door and walks outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks onto the front lawn and looks around the sle neighborhood. He listens to the quiet. It's a stark contr from New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter roots through his briefcase and pulls out the FELA KUTI CD. He slips the CD into the stereo. He presses play FELA KUTI's, "DON'T GAG ME" blares over the speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is sitting in a chair and playing the drum along w the Fela song. He is only wearing a T-shirt and boxers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles talks to Walter. They stand up and shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three MOVERS are carefully removing the piano from Walter house as Walter and Barbara Watson look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter drives back down the highway. The Fela Kuti music playing. He is tapping on the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks quickly up the stairs to the fourth floor. H seems to be moving with a little more pep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he approaches his door, he hears music emanating from apartment. It's a PIANO SONATA. The music stops him in hi tracks. He listens for a couple of moments. Finally he wa inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter enters to find Mouna mopping the floor.   Fresh fl are on the table. She sees Walter and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns down the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not expect you so soon. I was just cleaning a bit. I hope you don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like this CD very much.   The music is lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the CD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna sets down the CD. She notices Walter's glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are different glasses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they new?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to make some lunch. Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter leaves. Then he returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering if...Thursday night ... Do you have plans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Walter, I have no plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I thought that...we might do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods and walks toward his room. Mouna watches him and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Tarek are talking. Tarek is very anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep moving people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I think to other detention centers. Two Moroccan guys were just moved. They had no idea. Suddenly they were just gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone said anything to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one in here knows anything. I'm not a criminal. I have committed no crime. What do they think? I'm a terrorist? There are no terrorists in here. The terrorists have money. They have support. This is not fair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Angrily) How do you know?! You're out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarek's question stops Walter in his tracks. Tarek tries regain his composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just... I'm starting to wonder if I'm ever going to get out of here. I sit in here at night and I keep thinking about Zainab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to play my music and live my life. What's so wrong about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, Mouna and Zainab are sitting at a cafe. Walter is his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into the phone) OK. OK. Please do. Thank you. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would make some calls but they can move him to another facility at their discretion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What facility? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said it could be anywhere. Upstate. Pennsylvania. There is even one in Louisiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louisiana? Where they had the floods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the lawyer say anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No he didn't know anything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one seems to know anything. It feels like Syria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren and the Bass player are playing. They have a new drummer. Mouna and Zainab sit at a back table talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna notices Zainab's necklace. Zainab takes it off and gives it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter buys two newspapers. One in English and one in Ara

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna walks along the street. She stops at a small CLOTHI STORE and looks into the window. She walks into the store

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna is sitting on her bed, speaking in Arabic. Walter, dressed in a jacket and tie, is sitting in his bedroom. Suddenly Mouna appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to keep you waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright. How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says hello. He wants to make sure that you are practicing your drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. You look very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. Should we go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna ride in the cab. Mouna looks out the win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This city is just so huge! It never ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab pulls over. Walter and Mouna climb out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter pays the Cab Driver and turns to Mouna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter points to the "Phantom of the Opera" marquee behin her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? The Phantom? Are we seeing it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Is that OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's wonderful. Thank you. I am so excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter smiles as he and Mouna walk toward the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights and sounds of Times Square. Walter and Mouna w through the throngs of tourists after the play. Walter ha a cab and they jump in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna both sit in a French restaurant finishin their salad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to say that show was really kind of scary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was kind of scary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The both smile. A WAITER approaches and picks up their plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you finished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. But I think I would like a glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't even think to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK. It's not every night that you see The Phantom. (To the Waiter) I'll have a cabernet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waiter leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been to theatre in a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. There is a place in Syria called Maaloula. It is a huge outdoor theater. It's beautiful. We used to take Tarek there to see concerts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waiter sets down the two GLASSES of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clink glasses and drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna, I've taken a leave of absence for the rest of the semester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is suddenly self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is suddenly self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought I might spend some more time in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, you do not have to do this for Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have to be in Connecticut. You have your teaching. And your book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not your problem, Walter. It's OK that you are busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her simple words strike a chord with Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not busy. Not at all. (Beat) Mouna, the truth is I haven't been doing any work for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just presented your paper at the conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is beginning to unravel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't even write it. I just read it. I've been teaching the same course for twenty years. It doesn't mean anything to me. None of it does. I pretend. I pretend that I'm busy. That I'm writing. Working. But I'm not doing anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter trails off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be. I appreciate you telling me this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waiter returns and pours some more water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, what would you do if you didn't teach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that is exciting. Not to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter considers this as if for the first time. He smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna, what do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mean for work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work in a car dealership. I take care of the accounting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's very exciting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna and Walter walk into the apartment. Mouna takes off coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?! Is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. Twelve-thirty! I have not been up this late in a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that happens a lot in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Walter. That was a very nice evening. It's the most fun I've had in a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Tarek I was going to take you. He was very happy about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna is touched by the comment. Her mood shifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that she turns and walks into her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter wakes up. He checks his watch. He notices that his phone is blinking. A message. He picks it up and listens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws open the door and hurries into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna is sitting at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a message from Tarek. Something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just that they were moving him. He didn't know what it meant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without another word, Mouna is up and putting on her coat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna ride in the cab. Walter is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well when do you expect him back? Can you have him call me the minute he is? It's an emergency. Thank you. (He hangs up.) He's still in court. (To the CAB DRIVER) Can you hurry please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna get out of the cab. Walter rushes in. Mo waits outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks up to the guard booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. I'm here for bed 38. Tarek Khalil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MALE GUARD checks the computer screen. Walter waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is no longer with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not sure? Was he moved to another facility? Another state? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just know that this detainee is no longer in the facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well can you ask someone who does know?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard picks up the phone and dials. He has a long conversation that Walter cannot hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are a few other visitors in the waiting room. They watch Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Did you find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been removed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Removed? To where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deported.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was deported this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He...how can that be? Is there any way to contact him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think so? What kind of answer is that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir. That's all the information that I have. Now please step away from the window. You can call the ICE if you have any further questions. The number is on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's wheels are spinning. He is helpless. He looks ar the room at all of the other immigrants visiting friends family members. They are watching him with blank faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. Please step away from my window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter doesn't move. He checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. For the last time, step away from my window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Walter turns and starts to walk out of the deten center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches the exit and then spins around and storms back toward the guard booth. He completely loses control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Angrily shouting) You can't just take people away like that! Do you hear me?! He was a good man. A good person! He had a life here! You can't just take away whoever you want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not fair! We are not just helpless children! Do you hear me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard just stares back blankly. The other visitors wa in disbelief. They are unaccustomed to this type of outbu as is Walter who now stands trembling in the middle of th room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as if something inside him snapped. Something that h has been holding on to for a long time. He is suddenly adrift. Unsure of what to do next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gently) Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter turns. Mouna is standing there. He looks at her. Helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter. Let's go. There is nothing we can do. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks a bit lost. He looks back at the Guard who j stares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches out and takes Walter's hand. And then she lea him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna ride in a taxi. They are both depleted. Mouna shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did nothing wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is overwhelmed by the events. She breaks down and sta to cry. Walter puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter watches as Mouna tells Zainab. Zainab buckles and Mouna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is looking out the window. Mouna walks out of the kitchen and turns out the light. She walks over and stand next to Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, I need to go back to Syria. I should to be there for Tarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you going to leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. I already bought a ticket. It's best for me to be there as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter just looks at her. The news is piercing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't be able to come back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna smiles warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna leans in and kisses him gently on the cheek. She tu and walks toward her room. Walter watches her go and then looks back onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is lying awake in bed. There is a knock at the doo He sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and a shaft of light cuts across the room. Mouna stands in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter stares at her for a moment and then turns down the sheets. Mouna walks over and lies down next time. Walter pulls the sheets back over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in silence for a long moment holding each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my fault. What happened to Tarek. I did receive the letter telling us to leave. I threw it away. I never told him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter can only listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were here for three years by the time the letter arrived. I had found a job. Tarek was in school. Everyone told me not to worry. That the government did not care. And it appeared to be true. And then, after time, you forget. You think that you really belong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter gently touches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arm around her and she collapses into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lie together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna and Walter are sitting in the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you visited your son in London?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should visit him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna takes a small decorative pouch out of her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter takes it and opens it. It's a WRIST BAND from Zain collection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab and I picked it out especially for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. It's very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna puts it on Walter's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I. You look cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You are very cool, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter smiles. Mouna checks her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The both stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter and Mouna arrive at the security check point. Moun sets down her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Walter. For everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans in and they hug long and hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouna kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (She whispers) I don't want to go, habibi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she picks up her bag and walks off. Walter watches h go. She turns and waves. Walter waves back and then she disappears into the security check point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks quickly along the street with his drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter approaches the subway and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter swipes his card and walks down into the subway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks along the subway platform. He stops about mi and sits down on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The uptown subway train enters and obscures our view of h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally the train pulls away. Walter is still sitting but he is playing his drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is fully committed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another train wipes frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zainab sits behind her table, staring straight ahead. We on her for a long moment and then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black Card: "Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearn to breathe free, the wretched refuse of your teeming shor Send these, the homeless, tempest-tost to me, I lift my l beside the golden door!" Printed on the pedestal of the Statue of Liberty
